alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 5:43AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, western Massachusetts and east central New York, including the following counties, in northwestern Connecticut, Litchfield. In western Massachusetts, Berkshire. In east central New York, Columbia and Dutchess. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Great Barrington, Amenia, Copake, Sheffield, Pine Plains, Otis, Ancram, Canaan, Millerton, Ashley Falls, Bethel, Salisbury, New Marlborough, Smithfield, Monterey, Tyringham, Joyceville, Hammertown, Taconic and Twin Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
